conclusion: To determine the time at which particles A and B are farthest apart, we need to analyze the area under the velocity-time (v-t) graph for each particle.
The area under the graph represents the displacement of each particle.
The area under each curve (A and B) gives the displacement of each particle.

premise: From 0 to t0, A is a triangle with base t0 and height 2v0.
From t0 to 2t0, A is a triangle with base t0 and height 2v0.
From 2t0 to 3t0, A is a triangle with base t0 and height 2v0.
From 0 to 3t0, B is a trapezoid with bases 0 and v0, and height 3t0.
From 3t0 to 5t0, B is a rectangle with base 2t0 and height v0.
From 5t0 to 6t0, B is a triangle with base t0 and height v0.
Compare the cumulative displacements of A and B at each interval.
conclusion: At t = 3t0, A has a displacement of 3t0 v0 and B has 3/2 t0 v0.

premise: The difference in displacement is 3t0 v0 - 3/2 t0 v0.
